. It is comprised of 3 towns, Lytham, Ansdell and St. Annes. It is a fairly affluent area, having being and still is a place that wealthy people retired to after generating wealthy in a city.
Lytham is served by trains from Preston on the Blackpool South Line.
Blackpool International Airport is four miles away, whilst
offers a wider selection of destinations.
Take the M55 then follow signs for Lytham St Annes.

Walking is the best way to get around, Lytham is only small!
Bus service, the numbers 2, 7 & 11 travel through Lytham.

value: Lytham Green - a mile long stretch of grass between the beach and the town.
Windmill & RNLI museum located on lytham green.
Heritage Centre - located on Henry Street, the heritage centre is where you will find all the information on lytham's history. Regular exhibitions are held by local artists, painters, craft, etc.
Lowther Gardens - medium-sized park with tennish courts and bowling green.

Take a stroll around the picturesque Fairhaven Lake. Enjoy a coffee and a bite to eat in the accommodating cafe. There is a RSPB exhibition located here which is free entry. On a sunny day the grassy banks are an ideal place to enjoy a picnic, with great views over the Ribble estuary to Southport.

value: Postcards - lytham is a nice town. Winner of Fylde in Bloom.

Lytham is spoilt for choice when it comes to restaurants.

value: , Henry St. An Italian style restaurant that is very popular.
Greek restaurant located on the corner of Clifton Street and Station Road.
A small cafe offering luxurious cakes and snacks - great for tea and cake on an afternoon. Try the pavlova.
Good quality Indian restaurant - twinned with The Moghul in St. Anne's.
, Clifton Street, opposite the war memorial. A licensed cafe/diner with some of the best home made burgers around.
content=Always lively. Excellent choice of real ale.  CAMRA's Lancashire Pub of the Year 2005
content=Continental style bar. Relaxing and classy.
A very popular and lively pub among young locals Thu-Sat.
, Henry Street. Another stylish cocktail / wine bar serving a vast array of cocktails.
Pub situated next to Lytham train station, serves some good real ales and is popular as it is the only pub to stay open 'till 12 every day!
content=Right in the centre of Lytham.
content=Boutique hotel with spa. Views over the Irish Sea and very close to Royal Lytham Golf Club. ****
content=Beautiful period hotel with en-suite rooms and magnificant sea-views
content=Boutique hotel and B&B in Lytham St Annes.
